title: Venezuela: Ernesto J. Tovar Wins Citi Journalism Award for Excellence 2012
summary: Caracas - Ernesto Tovar, head of the microeconomics desk at El Universal, won the Citi Journalism Award for Excellence 2012 for his piece, "MKG usó al menos $109 millones para comprar bonos Pdvsa 2014" ("Michael Kenwood Group Used at Least $109 million to buy 2014 PDVSA Bonds"), published March 13, 2011. Ernesto will join more than 20 reporters from around the world as Venezuela's delegate at a seminar on economic and financial journalism at New York's Columbia University.
tag-1: Venezuela: Ernesto J. Tovar Wins Citi Journalism Award for Excellence 2012
tag-3: Caracas – Ernesto Tovar, head of the microeconomics desk at El Universal, won the Citi Journalism Award for Excellence 2012 for his piece, "MKG usó al menos $109 millones para comprar bonos Pdvsa 2014" ("Michael Kenwood Group Used at Least $109 million to buy 2014 PDVSA Bonds"), published March 13, 2011. Ernesto will join more than 20 reporters from around the world as Venezuela's delegate at a seminar on economic and financial journalism at New York's Columbia University.
tag-4: According to Nelson Acosta, President of Citibank Venezuela, the professional development seminar is designed to educate participants in principles of finance and accounting and offer them in-depth understanding of and exposure to the institutions that shape policies and trends in economic thought.
tag-5: "One of the fundamental objectives of our institution is to promote education, and we are cognizant of the influential role journalists play in this mission. We try to promote the importance of training social communicators to be responsible and commit themselves to go beyond the news to report topics of interest and relevance for the country and the entire world, especially in the areas of economics, finance, strategy and business," Acosta explained.
tag-6: The 2012 seminar will be held in New York City on June 4-13.
tag-7: Ernesto Tovar, who has a degree in social communication from Universidad Católica Andrés Bello (UCAB), was the winner of the Balboa Award for Ibero-American Journalists in 2010. He has been on the staff of El Universal for seven years and has covered areas such as energy, hydrocarbons and microeconomics.
tag-8: "Journalists, for better or worse, become empirical experts at what we do every day. In economics, however, academic training is an essential foundation for professionals who want to write high-quality, in-depth and accurate articles," Tovar commented. "The Citi Journalism Award for Excellence offers me an opportunity for better training at a top academic institution in the financial capital of the United States."
tag-9: Other Venezuelans attending the seminar included Víctor Salmerón, head of El Universal's finance desk, and Angie Contreras, a reporter for the same newspaper, who were first and second runner-ups for the award.
tag-10: Citi honored the three finalists on March 15 at the bank's headquarters in Caracas at an event attended by Citi board members and leading figures in economics, the media and public opinion.
tag-11: The jury that selected the winners of the 2012 award in Venezuela included Txomin Las Heras, Director de Institutional Communications at Venezuela's Central Bank; economist José Guerra; Luis Vicente León, director of the Datanalisis polling firm; Andrés Rojas, a reporter for El Nacional and a previous winner of the Citi award; and Sol Vargas, Information Manager at Venevisión.
tag-12: The Citi Journalism Award for Excellence has honored journalists around the world since 1982. For 29 years it has recognized and supported the work of journalists covering economic affairs in many countries within the Citibank network.
